events.name: Clean & Green Hackathon 2015
events.description:
CLEAN & GREEN HACKATHON 2015 
 The Clean & Green Hackathon 2015 (19 to 21 June) is a big step towards cultivating a collective environmental consciousness amongst those of us who call Singapore home. It's an exciting opportunity to apply your expertise and help us become a more active and gracious society, one that respects the environment and takes care of our public spaces.   
The Clean & Green Pre-Hackathon Workshop gives you the chance to gain deeper insights into the hackathon themes and apply them when designing appropriate programmes or applications that address these issues at the hackathon. 
REGISTER FOR THE WORKSHOP 
 

  
Hackathon Programme 
Coders, contribute your awesome tech skills. As for everyone else, we welcome people from all backgrounds to take part and contribute in your own way.    
• Kick-off night (Friday, 19 June): Features expert presentations to inspire you with some thought-starters and give you an overview of the challenges you can tackle. This is where you can pitch your ideas and form teams.   
• Day 2 (Saturday, 20 June): The day will be spent working with your team to develop your idea and prototype it. You'll also receive support from mentors to help you strengthen your idea and overcome roadblocks.   
• Day 3 (Sunday, 21 June): The morning starts with presentation clinics to help refine your pitch, followed by presentations to the judges in the afternoon. There's a prize pool of $6,000 to be won! 
 If you're not still not sure, why not come down for the kick-off to get a taste of what the hackathon will be like.  
 Date: Friday, 19 June (Kick-off) 
Time: 6.30pm - 9.30pm 
Venue: LaunchPad@ One-North, #04-03/04 Blk 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139955 
 
More Info 
Find out more about the hackathon here. If you've got any questions feel free to get in touch with the hackathon organisers at hello@upsingapore.com. 
LaunchPad @ One-North04-03/04, Blk 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent Singapore 139955
events.location: Launchpad@One-North, , Block 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #04-03/04, Singapore 139955

events.name: Guide to iOS Apps Programming 1
events.description:
This workshops introduces the participants to the basics of developing apps in iOS environment. You will learn the fundamentals of app design and logic. As well as understanding more about functions, structures and data needed to write simple apps. All participants are required to bring their own MacBook and iPhone to make the workshop a meaningful experience. 
  
  
This workshop, together with 4 other workshops including  Guide to Android Apps Programming, Guide to iOS Apps Programming 2, Working With Data and Learn to write a WordPress/Rezkii plugin with web services are pre-workshops that lead up to the actual *hackathon day.  
  
*Participants' for this workshop are not required to attend the hackathon, but if you want to, here's where you sign up: Mosque Tech Challenge 
  
On the day of the workshop, do look out for signages to "The Hive" to find the classroom.  
Contacts: 9760 9715 (Sabri) / 9171 0955 (Hakim)
events.location: Blk K, Level 4 Room K407, , ITE College Central, 2 Ang Mo Kio Drive, Singapore 567720

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Saturday 20th, Sunday 21st and Monday 22nd June 2015 10am to 7pm (Last entry at 6.30pm) ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE SIDM Art Interactive Experience Alumni x Students Experience a selection of vibrant new works from our students and renowned SIDM alumni. It will be a coming-together of creative minds from raw potentials, to established talents in the local IDM and Creative Arts Industry. The first of its kind, this event organized by the School of Interactive & Digital Media will showcase their creative works to industry and public audiences at the prestigious ArtScience Museum.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Write Taster
events.description:
Find out how it feels like to be a writer for two engaging hours. 
This workshop gives you an overview of the writing approach and allow you to experience narrative writing with practical instructions and guided exercises. 
  
At the end of this workshop, you will understand the writing process and practise different ways of writing. 
  
This is a small group event. Reserve your seat today! 
  
Please note this workshop is designed for 19-years old and above. 
  
Comments from past participants. 
  
          "I came with no knowledge at all on writing and glad to learn what to consider and how to start writing to different people on different topics” 
  
          “Excellent! One of the best ways to spend Saturday morning. Didn't know writing can be this fun.”
events.location: 13-06 Paya Lebar Square, , #13-06, 60, Paya Lebar Road, Paya Lebar Square,, SINGAPORE 409051

events.name: DSSG Social Network, Kaggle like a Pro & Dengue Clusters Analysis June Meetup
events.description: *To cater to a larger crowd, we will setup a live stream room at SMU SOE 5-1 (same floor) and online via https://www.periscope.tv/ . Do come early if you want to be in the main room, as we will move people to the live stream room once main room is full. This month, we are excited to have speakers that will share with us insights from their data science projects! Agenda (More details to be announced): • 1pm - 1.15pm: Chat and BYOR (Bring your own refreshments) • 1.15pm - 2.15pm: Kaggle Otto Challenge - How we achieved 85th out of 3,514 and what we learnt by Eugene Yan & Wang Weimin. Synopsis: Kaggle is an online predictive model competition platform with more than 300k members and counting. For this talk, two of our members will share their experience in one of the most population Kaggle competitions and what they learnt. • 2.15pm - 3pm: DataScience SG social network analysis by Michael Ng • 3pm - 3.20pm: Association Rules on Dengue Locations by Rufeng Xie. Visualization: http://outbreak.sgcharts.com/ Rufeng will talk about his experience in mining association rules from historical dengue data in Singapore. He will investigate both the geospatial and temporal relationships in his analysis. • 3.20pm - 3.30pm: Closing and networking Linkedin Profile: • Michael: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=39150404 • Eugene: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=100188469 • Wang Weimin: https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=87948135 • Rufeng Xie: Computer Science masters student at NUS.
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), 90 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.name: Working With Data
events.description:
This workshop aims to guide participants who will be learning data value chain (including data gathering and cleaning), basic sql, basic R, Python and RapidMiner to enable them to manage and work with data. This two-part workshop will start off with the first 2 hours learning the basic theories of data processing and management. Participant would then be able to implement what they have learnt in the second half of the workshop. Participants are encouraged to have basic programming and statistics knowledge and to bring their own laptops to make the workshop a meaningful experience. 
  
 
  
This workshop, together with 4 other workshops including Guide to Android Apps Programming, Guide to iOS Apps Programming 1, Guide to iOS Apps Programming 2, and Learn to write a WordPress/Rezkii plugin with web services are pre-workshops that lead up to the actual *hackathon day.

events.name: Arduino Workshop
events.description:
Until recently you needed a strong technical education to use a microcontroller to build amazing gizmos and gadgets. 
All this changed with the arrival of the Arduino, a cool, easy to use, community driven microcontroller board with tons of software, tutorials, code samples and videos online all for free. 
Coupled with the inexpensive hardware this means that many can venture boldly into trying new ideas with a far lower chance of blowing things up and a far higher chance of success in a realistic timeframe. 
In this class you will learn how to control things like LED, servo motors and LCD panels as well as detecting things like changes in light levels and reading codes entered on a keypad, but the biggest thing that you will learn is the confidence to venture on your own to build amazing things that you never even thought about before. 
Requirements  HackerspaceSG and 12Geeks will be lending the Arduino Kits for the workshop, so all you need to bring is a notebook computer - Mac / Windows / Linux are all compatible. 
  
  
  
This workshop, together with 4 other workshops including Guide to iOS Apps Programming 1, Guide to iOS Apps Programming 2, Working With Data and Learn to write a WordPress/Rezkii plugin with web services are pre-workshops that lead up to the actual *hackathon day.  
  
*Participants' for this workshop are not required to attend the hackathon, but if you want to, here's where you sign up: Mosque Tech Challenge 
  
On the day of the workshop, do look out for signages to "The Hive" to find the classroom.  
Contacts: 9760 9715 (Sabri) / 9171 0955 (Hakim)
events.location: The Hive, Blk K, Level 4 Room K407, , ITE College Central, 2 Ang Mo Kio Drive, Singapore 567720

He will be presenting the following topic: Moving from Legacy PBXs to Skype for Business and Best practices\ recommendations for a smooth migration Also since we will have the Lync Room System room, we can walk thru the LRS system for those who have not got their hands on one. Venue: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard Level 22 , Meeting Room - ROOM 22BR-01, Singapore 6:30pm to 7:15 is food and refreshments and networking. 7:15pm to 8:15pm - 1st session from Thamara Wijesinghe 8:15 to 8:30pm - drinks and break. 8:30pm to 9:30pm - LRS introduction and demo.

events.name: National Cloud Computing Distinguished Speaker Series - Brian Mathews
events.description:
Capture, Compute, Create: How cloud technology is changing design 
  
Abstract 
The impulse to design is universal, but the tools for changing our world have been limited. Recent cloud technologies are disrupting how professionals design, how non-professionals participate, and how new tools may solve the world’s toughest challenges. This presentation explores the cloud technology trends that are combining to revolutionize the future of making things: Reality Capture, Cloud Data, Infinite Computing, Computational Physics, and 3D Creation. 
  
Biodata 
As Vice President and Platform Group CTO, Brian Mathews helps shape the technology strategy for Autodesk’s platforms and products serving the design, engineering, and construction industries.  He also heads the Reality Computing and Sustainability Solutions business units.  Reality computing involves sensor techniques such as 3D laser scanning, augmented reality, photogrammetry, computer vision, and reverse engineering to model the world.  Previously, he was VP of Autodesk Labs, a hub connecting design professionals with innovative technologies.  He held Software Architecture and Engineering Management positions for collaboration solutions, data publishing, and the graphics technology used in several products including AutoCAD. Prior to Autodesk, he was the Chief Architect at Buzzsaw.com, the leading cloud collaboration tool for the construction industry, and held technical positions at Sun Microsystems and Ithaca Software. Mathews earned his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University. He was the original creator of the DWF format and holds a variety of patents.
events.location: Genexis Theatre, , Fusionopolis, 1 Fusionopolis Way, Fusionopolis (Connexis Tower), Singapore 138632

events.name: HIKVISION CCTV Training (Singapore) -  June 2015 (Back-End Product Road Map/ Turbo TVI)
events.description:
Hikvision Singapore Pte Ltd, has introduced classroom learning to help dealers and installers get up to speed on Hikvision video products. 
Three training modules catered to pre-sales and technical, which are available free to Hikvision customers, let them spend some time in Hikvision Singapore office to learn about the features built into the company’s cameras, DVRs and software. 
  
Agenda for this Training: 
2:30pm - 3:00pm Register/ Tea and Get-Know Session 
3:00pm-3:30pm   Introduction of Back-End Road Map 
3:30-4pm             Tea Break 
4:00pm- 4:30pm   Introduction to Turbo HD Camera and Turbo series DVR- TVI Product Demo iVMS 5200 
 4:30pm - 6:00pm Hikvision Turbo HD Camera and DVR (Hands-On) 
  
  
Hikvision is the world's largest supplier of video surveillance products and solutions. The company specializes in video surveillance technology, as well as designing and manufacturing a full-line of innovative CCTV and video surveillance products. The product line ranges from cameras and DVRs to video management software. Since its inception in 2001, Hikvision has quickly achieved a leading worldwide market position in the security industry. 
Hikvision possess the world's largest R&D team and state-of-art manufacturing facilities; both allow Hikvision’s customers the benefit of world-class products that are designed with cutting-edge technology. As further commitment to its customers, Hikvision annually reinvests 7% of its revenue into R&D for continued product innovation and improvement.
Hikvision operates over 30 domestic branches in China and 16 overseas regional subsidiaries all over the world to achieve a truly global presence. Hikvision is now publicly listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
Hikvision customers who wish to register their interest in taking advantage of the training modules or to find out more can do so by emailing: ryan.tan@hikvision.com or call 90027441.
events.location: HIKVISION SINGAPORE PTE LTD OFFICE, , 18 Sin Ming Ln,#08-07, MIDVIEW CITY, Singapore 573960

events.name: June Drupal Meetup (2): Automate with Rules
events.description: Sven Berg Ryen from X-Team is visiting Singapore and will giving a talk about: Rules is a fundamental Drupal module that allows site builders to bring a measure of automation to their sites. Rules works hand-in-hand with the Entity API to enable developers to configure events that will be executed whenever certain conditions are met. Events, Conditions and Actions. Build flexible workflows, send customised emails, create system redirections, system messages, breadcrumbs, etc. • How you can use the contributed modules to set up your own workflows in Drupal • How to write your own custom actions for Rules integration • How to use Rules in Drupal Commerce • How to use your actions in Views Bulk Operation About the Speakers: Sven Berg Ryen is a Senior Drupal Web Developer working for X-Team International. He now lives in Norway and visits Singapore once in a while. He was also one of the original founder of Drupal Community Singapore. He's also active giving talks in Drupal Community within South East Asia region. Directions The nearest MRT station is Promenade (Circle Line (yellow line)). Once you reach the place, ask the security guard or concierge that you want to go to Paypal's office at Level 14, they might ask for your ID to exchange for visitor pass. If you're lost, get in touch with Ardi @[masked]
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue, Level 14, Singapore 039192

events.name: ISS Seminar - Online Collaboration: Fact or Fiction?
events.description:
Online Collaboration is the child of Knowledge Management and the Internet, a new paradigm of professional cooperation in organisations made possible by the social capabilities of the web. It is also the open secret to solving the productivity problems entrenched in many companies stuck in the world of emails and silos. Implementing and adopting online collaboration is, however, easier said than done.  
In this seminar, you will hear: 

State of online collaboration in Singapore
Overview of selected online collaboration tools
The importance of culture and adoption

 Who Should Attend Social Media Folks: professionals in the business of dealing with social, digital, marketing, branding, content, development and strategy, especially internal social. If you’re keen to find out what’s going to be relevant and beneficial to your business and life in the fast-paced world of social, this seminar is for you.  
For detailed agenda, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/OnlineCollaborationFactorFiction.aspx 
  
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: Cyber Espionage Activities on IOT Devices
events.description:
With the encouraging response from our previous seminar, KICC & NSHC has decided to continue sharing top classified information on Cyber Espionage Activities on IOT devices. The main objective of this seminar is to create awareness and educate the public on the critical threat in the current environment. There will also be exciting live demonstration on CCTV and VOIP hacking. 
  
Topic 
               Introduction about NSHC 
               How Safe is Your IOT devices 
  
-          Discovery of Cyber Espionage Status on Different Countries  
  
-          Cyber Spying Activities on IOT devices 
  
-          Cyber Espionage Activities on CCTV/IP Camera 
  
Live Demonstration 
  
-          Technical Live Demo on CCTV/IP Camera Spying 
  
-          Technical Live Demo on VOIP(Skype) Hacking 
Conclusion 
Q&A
events.location: Korea IT Cooperation Center Conference Room,, , 8 Shenton Way AXA Tower, #04-01,, Singapore 068811

events.name: Mobile Growth Hackers at BASH with HotelQuickly, 99.co, and PicoCandy
events.description:
We're excited to announce that our first Mobile Growth Hackers meetup in Singapore will be June 25! Come meet other GrowthHackers, network, have some snacks and drinks, and get great tips on how to drive success for your mobile app. 
Our Meetup will be held at Block 79 JTC LaunchPad @ one-north. 
Hear from a panel of mobile growth experts and get deeper insight into the strategies they used to grow their mobile apps. 
Panelists 

Tomas Laboutka, CEO, HotelQuickly
Anuj Bheda, CEO, 99.co
Austin Hay, Partner Growth, Branch Metrics
Khang Toh, PicoCandy Co-founder 

 The panel will be moderated by Viren Shetty, a passionate Mobile GrowthHacker. 
The discussion will run from 7pm to 8pm, with plenty of time for Q&A at the end. Before and after the panel, you'll have time to chat with your fellow GrowthHackers and enjoy pizza and drinks. 
Check out the Meetup page: 
http://www.meetup.com/Singapore-Mobile-Growth-Meetup/events/223113072/ 
Join the discussion on Facebook: 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/growth.mobile/ 
See you at BASH!
events.location: BASH @ Block 79, , 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03, Singapore null

events.name: 2nd Bluemix SG Meetup: Building your mobile backend with Bluemix and SoftLayer
events.description: It's another meetup with Bluemix, and this month we're going to introduce how you can build your mobile backend with Bluemix. We've also teamed up with SoftLayer to tell you more about what MobileFirst Platform is, and how you can deploy your MobileFirst Platform on SoftLayer. In the spirit of our Bluemix meetups, we will focus on technical demos. Agenda: 7pm - 7.30pm: Registration + Pizza 7.30pm - 8.30pm: How to build your iOS or Android mobile backend with Bluemix 8.30pm - 9.30pm: Set up and Run your MobileFirst Platform on SoftLayer How to build your iOS or Android mobile backend with Bluemix Learn how to easily set up your mobile backend really quickly, with monitoring and logging capabilities, data synchronisation, push notifications, and much more. Set up and run your MobileFirst Platform on SoftLayer Learn how and why Mobile App developers run their MobileFirst environment + their iOS and Android Apps in production on SoftLayer. Gain Practical insights in a hands-on demo on how you can quickly and easily design and provision the IBM SoftLayer reference architecture for MobileFirst.
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: Creative Coding Meetup - Virtual Reality Special
events.description: This coming session will be a unique collaborative meetup and networking opportunity be all about Virtual Reality. Together with the Singapore VR/AR and StoryCode meetup groups, we will discuss latest developments in the local scene, how VR is changing the way we tell and experience stories. Various local media experts will share their knowledge and local VR projects. We will also discuss how trailblazing VR initiatives from abroad can be adopted locally. Join us in this exciting collaborative exchange on 25 June 2015, 7pm. Program: • 0. Refreshments + networking • 1. Introduction of combined event + introductions of Creative Coding, VR/AR and Storycode Singapore meetup groups • 2. Talk 1: Eugene Soh's - Using VR tools in Fun Unconventional Approaches Eugene had a 'virtual reality' installation at Singapore Art Museum last year but it wasn't what you would expect. Eugene brings you 3 ways to use VR tools in fun non-conventional VR ways • 3. Talk 2: Himanshu Shah - Virtual Reality based Amusement Park Ride Simulator • 4. Screening TED Talk by Chris milk (How virtual reality can create the ultimate empathy machine) • 5. Panel Q&A • 6. Panel discussion of The Void (an augmented reality/virtual reality theme park) and how to make it work. • 7. mingle / networking This meetup will be the collaboration of: Singapore Creative Coding meetup http://www.meetup.com/Singapore-Creative-Coding-Meetup/ Singapore StoryCode meetup http://www.meetup.com/StoryCode-Singapore Singapore VR/AR meetup http://www.meetup.com/Singapore-Virtual-Reality-Augmented-Reality-Meetup/ Venue: Zendesk office #07-01, 401 Commonwealth Drive, Haw Par Technocentre, 118407 Directions getting to Zendesk office: its a 5 minutes walks from Commonwealth MRT, and take the elevator from Lobby B. Speaker profiles: - Eugene Soh: Eugene Soh is a Singaporean fine artist who happens to be a programming genius. When he isn't travelling the world, he is at home making apps or creating epic photographic renditions of famous renaissance paintings. Eugene has recently taken a strong interest in harvesting energy from the sun (solar power, because he hates paying bills) and may be moving in that direction. - Himanshu Shah: Virtual Reality based Amusement Park Ride Simulator Himanshu Shah has been in the production industry for the last 15 years and is involved in a number of companies. Amongst the companies he is currently involved in is one that does stereoscpic 3D video production. His latest company is involved in the creation of VR Rides.
events.location: Zendesk | Zopim Office, 401 Commonwealth Drive Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01, Singapore

events.name: BayesiaLab Workshop: Artificial Intelligence for Research, Analytics, and Reasoning
events.description:
In fields ranging from bioinformatics to marketing science, Bayesian networks have revolutionized the way scientists explore high-dimensional problem domains. And, since the first release of the BayesiaLab software package in 2001, practitioners have been able to leverage this powerful paradigm for their research without having to write a single line of code. 
Learn what the Bayesian networks revolution is all about, and join Stefan Conrady and Dr. Lionel Jouffe for a complimentary workshop on knowledge discovery with Bayesian networks and BayesiaLab. In the presentation, we will first lay out the basics of the Bayesian network formalism and then illustrate a practical application in a live software demo. 
Target Audience: 
Applied researchers, statisticians, data scientists, data miners, biologists, biostatisticians, epidemiologists, predictive modelers, econometricians, economists, engineers, market researchers, knowledge managers, marketing scientists, social scientists, students and teachers in related fields.
events.location: Matrix @ Biopolis, , 30 Biopolis St, Level 4, Singapore 138671

events.name: Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling Workshop 2015
events.description:
CENSAM Annual Workshop 2015 
















CENSAM Annual Workshop 2015



 



View this email in your browser







 



 





 


ANNUAL WORKSHOP 2015







 








  
29 JUNE 2015    UTOWN AUDITORIUM 1  @ TOWN PLAZA,  CREATE CAMPUS, NUS   



GET DIRECTIONS













   CENSAM 8th Annual Workshop  






Organisers' message:    The Center for Environmental Sensing and Modeling (CENSAM) is pleased to invite you to its 8th Annual Workshop on the 29th June, 2015. In this year's programme, we highlight ongoing Singapore-MIT collaborative work on the following themes: AIR, WATER and SENSORS. A number of CENSAM researchers and collaborators will present talks and posters, providing a sense of the range of interdisciplinary research being conducted at CENSAM. 
In addition, the projects funded by CENSAM Research Initiative Programme, starting this year as a new effort to encourage junior scientists to drive their own research activities, will be showcased in each section (indicated with *).    We are pleased to announce that Steve Leonard (Deputy Chairman, IDA), Prof Federico Lauro (Associate Professor, Singapore Centre on Environmental Life Sciences Engineering/NTU) and Prof Mikinori Kuwata (Assistant Professor, Earth Observatory of Singapore/NTU) will present keynote talks. 
This year we have a significant number of posters presented, so please make sure to set aside time during coffee and lunch breaks (3h) to enjoy one-on-one interaction with the presenters.    We look forward to your participation at CENSAM's 8th Annual Workshop. Please click the register button below and do not hesitate to contact us if you require further information/assistance. 








 







REGISTER HERE











 








CONTACT ORGANISERS 












  
 

 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 




  Do feel free to circulate this invitation to colleagues who might be interested in attending our workshop.

events.name: HIKVISION CCTV Training (Singapore) -  June 2015 (Solutions for Car Plate Recognition / People Counting for Retail)
events.description:
Hikvision Singapore Pte Ltd, has introduced classroom learning to help dealers and installers get up to speed on Hikvision video products. 
Three training modules catered to pre-sales and technical, which are available free to Hikvision customers, let them spend some time in Hikvision Singapore office to learn about the features built into the company’s cameras, DVRs and software. 
  
Agenda for this Training: 
2:30pm - 3:00pm Register/ Tea and Get-Know Session 
3:00pm-3:30pm   Introduction to Hikvision Company and Summary of Smart Products 
3:30-4pm             Tea Break 
4:00pm- 4:30pm   Solutions on Car Plate Recognition for carpark 
4:30pm - 5:00pm  People Counting for retail. 
5:00pm onwards   Project Discussion / Appointment Setting 
  
Hikvision is the world's largest supplier of video surveillance products and solutions. The company specializes in video surveillance technology, as well as designing and manufacturing a full-line of innovative CCTV and video surveillance products. The product line ranges from cameras and DVRs to video management software. Since its inception in 2001, Hikvision has quickly achieved a leading worldwide market position in the security industry. 
Hikvision possess the world's largest R&D team and state-of-art manufacturing facilities; both allow Hikvision’s customers the benefit of world-class products that are designed with cutting-edge technology. As further commitment to its customers, Hikvision annually reinvests 7% of its revenue into R&D for continued product innovation and improvement.
Hikvision operates over 30 domestic branches in China and 16 overseas regional subsidiaries all over the world to achieve a truly global presence. Hikvision is now publicly listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
Hikvision customers who wish to register their interest in taking advantage of the training modules or to find out more can do so by emailing: ryan.tan@hikvision.com or call 90027441.
events.location: HIKVISION SINGAPORE PTE LTD OFFICE, , 18 Sin Ming Ln,#08-07, MIDVIEW CITY, Singapore 573960

events.name: Maxwell's wave or Einstein's LichtQuanten? The weirdness of light
events.description:
Maxwell's wave or Einstein's LichtQuanten? The weirdness of light  
Since the early days of quantum mechanics, interference between spatially separated trajectories of a single particle has not ceased to fascinate physicists. I will present experiments realized with a single photon, which have allowed us to emphasize the weirdness of the concept of wave particle duality, at the root of the quantum revolution of the 20th century. Such single photon sources are now an important resource in the domain of quantum information and quantum cryptography. 
  
 
About the speaker 
Born in 1947, Alain Aspect is an alumnus of ENS Cachan and Université d'Orsay. After three years teaching in Cameroon, he became a lecturer at ENS Cachan, with his research at Institut d'Optique. In 1985 he took a research position at ENS/Collège de France, with Claude Cohen-Tannoudji. Since 1992 he has been a CNRS senior researcher (emeritus since 2012), at Institut d'Optique. He is also a professor at Institut d'Optique Graduat School (Augustin Fresnel chair), and at Ecole Polytechnique, in Palaiseau. He is a member of the Académie des Sciences (France), Académie des Technologies (France), National Academy of Sciences (USA), OAW (Austria). 
  
Alain Aspect's first research involved tests of Bell's inequalities with entangled photon pairs (PhD 1983), then wave-particle duality for single photons. With Claude Cohen-Tannoudji he developed new methods for cooling atoms with lasers. Since 1992, he is in the Atom Optics group that he has established at Institut d'Optique, where research bears upon quantum atom optics, quantum degenerate gases and atom lasers, quantum simulators of disordered materials. 
  
   
  
This event is organised by the Centre for Quantum Technologies, National University of Singapore in partnership with the Science Centre Singapore.
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, , 15 Science Centre Rd, Singapore 609081
events.group_name: Centre for Quantum Technologies, National University of Singapore

events.name: 2-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101
events.description:
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore 
"Currently, Bayesian Networks have become one of the most complete, self-sustained and coherent formalisms used for knowledge acquisition, representation and application through computer systems." (Bouhamed et al., 2015) 
Join this course to learn about the principles of Bayesian networks and how to apply them for research and analytics with the BayesiaLab software platform. You will see that Bayesian networks are ideally suited to model a wide range of high-dimensional problem domains. Overall, this course's focus in on leveraging Bayesian networks for applied research, with the objective of solving problems that currently appear difficult or intractable with traditional statistical methods. 
This "short course" is a compact version of the highly acclaimed 3-Day Introductory BayesiaLab Course, which we have been offering around the world for almost ten years. We have designed this new 2-day course for scientists who are interested in utilizing Bayesian networks for their research, but for whom the current 3-day program might be too much of a time commitment. 
Throughout this course, we exclusively use the BayesiaLab software platform. Therefore, you have access to a full license of BayesiaLab Professional for a 30-day period starting on the first day of the course. This gives you the opportunity to replicate all examples from the course at your leisure on your own computer. 
 
Date and Location 
July 2-3, 2015 9:00am-5:00pm (both days) 
Singapore Management University School of Accountancy 60 Stamford Road Seminar Room 2.5 Singapore 178899 
Overview 
Day 1 

Introductory Examples of Probabilistic Reasoning:
Prosecutor's Fallacy
Simpson's Paradox
Bayes' Rule and the Bayesian Network Formalism
Graph Structures, d-Separation
Encoding Bayesian Networks from Domain Knowledge
Omnidirectional Inference for Diagnosis and Simulation
Observation versus Intervention/Causation

Day 2 

Prerequisites for Machine-Learning Bayesian Networks:
Information Theory, incl. Entropy, Mutual Information, Minimum Description Length
Unsupervised Structural Learning for Knowledge Discovery
Supervised Learning for Predictive Modeling, Feature Selection
Variable Clustering
Data Clustering
Latent Factor Inductions and Probabilistic Structural Equation Models
Network Analysis and Simulation
Using Bayesian Networks for Decision Support

What's required?  

Working knowledge of specifying and estimating linear models.
No prior knowledge of Bayesian networks or Bayesian statistics is required.
No programming skills are required. You will use the graphical user interface of BayesiaLab for all exercises in class.

Who should attend?  
Bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, clinical scientists, computer scientists, data scientists, decision scientists, demographers, ecologists, econometricians, economists, epidemiologists, knowledge managers, management scientists, market researchers, marketing scientists, operations research analysts, policy analysts, predictive modelers, research investigators, risk managers, social scientists, statisticians, plus students and teachers of related fields. 
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Accountancy, , 60 Stamford Road, Seminar Room 2.5, Singapore 178899

events.name: Write Taster
events.description:
Find out how it feels like to be a writer for two engaging hours. 
This workshop gives you an overview of the writing approach and allow you to experience narrative writing with practical instructions and guided exercises. 
  
At the end of this workshop, you will understand the writing process and practise different ways of writing. 
  
This is a small group event. Reserve your seat today! 
  
Please note this workshop is designed for 19-years old and above. 
  
Comments from past participants. 
  
          "I came with no knowledge at all on writing and glad to learn what to consider and how to start writing to different people on different topics” 
  
          “Excellent! One of the best ways to spend Saturday morning. Didn't know writing can be this fun.”

events.name: CREATE Symposium 2015: Future Mobility
events.description:
The inaugural 'CREATE Symposium 2015: Future Mobillity' is jointly organised by the three CREATE programmes, Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology Future Urban Mobility (SMART FM), Future Cities Laboratory of the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) and TUM CREATE. It will be held on 8 to 9 July 2015 at the Ngee Ann Kongsi Auditorium in the National University of Singapore’s University Town (NUS U-Town).  
The symposium will be organised along four tracks: Autonomous Vehicles, E-Mobility, Intelligent Transportation Systems, and Modelling and Simulation. Each day will feature plenary sessions where the distinguished speakers present highlights of their research and demo sessions where flagship projects of CREATE research entities will be exhibited. Participants can expect to engage in discussions on the current state of the art, future research and potential challenges for applications and market deployment.  
The inaugural  'CREATE Symposium: Future Mobillity' presents an excellent opportunity to learn more about the exciting research and developments in Future Mobility at CREATE, and to meet researchers working on future mobility within and beyond CREATE, in Singapore.
events.location: Ngee Ann Kongsi Auditorium, , 8 College Avenue West, University Town, National University of Singapore, Singapore 138608
events.group_name: Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology (SMART), Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) and TUM CREATE

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm 2015:time:space: By Robert Casteels, Dirk Stromberg and Andrew Thomas 7.30pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 2015:time:space: is a collaborative work of voices, electronic instruments, live processing, tape and video. New electronic instruments are altered in real time, fusing effortlessly with the human voice. Projected against this kaleidoscope of sound will be stunning pre-recorded images of Singapore, tying in sounds from humanity to the technology of our modern world, crossing time and space. Original production generously supported by the National Arts Council. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.

events.name: Singapore Microbiome Networking Symposium
events.description:
Singapore Microbiome Networking Symposium  
NUS Centre for Life Sciences, Auditorium 
Monday, 28th July 2015 
Time: 09:00-16:00  

  
Sponsored by Department of Biochemistry (National University of Singapore, NUS) and American Society of Microbiology (ASM), Singapore Micriobiome Networking Symposium aims to promote scientific exchanges and collaborations in the field of Microbiome Research. 
This year, with the support of Singapore Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (SSBMB), Singapore Society for Microbiology and Biotechnology (SSMB), Department of Microbiology (NUS), and NUS Synthetic Biology for Clinical and Technological Innovation (SynCTI), the symposium will be held in NUS Centre for Life Sciences Auditorium. Invited speakers will be sharing developments and new insights on the human microbiome. 
We warmly invite graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, fellow biologists and researchers to attend this special event. Come join us and find out the latest developments in microbiome research! 
  
PS: Please select the ticket type "Expression of Interest Talk" to indicate that you wish to present in this networking symposium (Duration: 5 min).  
  
Organising committee: 
A/P Gan Yunn Hwen (Chair) 
A/P Yew Wen Shan 
A/P Thilo Hagen 
A/P Lee Yuan Kun 
Dr Ratha Mahendran 
  
 FAQs  
1. Where is the event held? 
The event will be held at the Auditorium located at the first floor of CeLS. 
The full address is as follows: 
  
National University of Singapore 
Centre for Life Sciences 
28 Medical Drive 
Singapore 117456 
  
  
2. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Arriving by public transport (Bus) 

Take bus service 95 at bus-stop along MOE building.
Service 95 will turn into the National University Hospital (NUH).
Alight at the 1st bus stop.
You should see a gentle slope up towards Medical Drive. Walk up Medical Drive until you reach the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building on your right.     

Arriving by public transport (MRT) 

If you’re not on Circle Line, take the MRT to Buona Vista.
Make that switch to Circle Line to Kent Ridge Station.
Alight at Kent Ridge Station.
Walk towards Kopitiam Foodcourt towards the other end of National University Hospital (NUH) main building. You should then see a gentle slope up towards Medical Drive. Walk up Medical Drive until you reach the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building on your right.    

Arriving by private transport/taxi 

Take a taxi or private vehicle to the Ayer Rajah Expressway (AYE).
Turn off at the South Buona Vista/NUH (National University Hospital) exit.
Head towards NUH (don’t turn into NUH) and go straight until you see Medical Drive. Turn left into Medical Drive and stop outside the Centre for Life Sciences (CeLS) building.
Private vehicles can park in the public carparks located in NUH Medical Centre or at the open air carpark atFaculty of Science, opposite Faculty of Dentistry.    

Science Carpark 
Operating Hours: 0830 to 1930 
Parking Rates: $0.0214 per minute (maximum charge of $1.284 for vehicles entering from 6pm to 7.30pm on weekdays) 
NUH Medical Centre 
Operating Hours: 0000 to 2359 
Parking Rates: $0.035 per minute
events.location: Centre for Life Sciences, , 28 Medical Drive, National University of Singapore, Singapore 117456

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already. After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you. Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that. Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week! What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. ** DISCLAIMER **: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #013
events.description: Paper #1: Learning to Transduce with Unbounded Memory: Alex Ognev - http://arxiv.org/abs/1506.02516 Paper #2: ?? ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG
